problems.title: Max Value of Equation (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
You are given an array points containing the coordinates of points on a 2D plane, sorted by the x-values. You are also given an integer k.
Return the maximum value of the equation yi + yj + |xi - xj| where |xi - xj| <= k and 1 <= i < j <= points.length.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Next n lines: two integers xi, yi.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum value.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4 1
1 3
2 0
5 10
6 -10

Sample Output
4

Explanation: First two points: 3 + 0 + |1-2| = 4.
hintsList: Equation can be rewritten as (yi - xi) + (yj + xj).
For a fixed j, we need to maximize (yi - xi) such that xi >= xj - k.
Use a monotonic queue to store pairs (yi - xi, xi).
